title: 103_s2323
content:
BAN ON DISCLOSURE OF MEDICAL QUALITY ASSURANCE INFORMATION. Section 5705 of title 38, United States Code, prohibits the disclosure of medical quality assurance records in judicial or administrative proceedings. No part of these records may be subject to discovery or admitted as evidence, and individuals involved in creating or reviewing these records cannot testify about them unless specified by the section. The amendment to section 5705 of title 38, United States Code, expands the disclosure of medical quality assurance records in certain circumstances, including for use in criminal or civil law enforcement proceedings and for professional licensing purposes. The amendment to section 5705 of title 38, United States Code allows for the disclosure of medical quality assurance records in specific situations, such as for assessing the professional qualifications of healthcare providers applying for positions in healthcare institutions or in administrative or judicial proceedings related to the termination or limitation of clinical privileges. The amendment allows for the disclosure of medical quality assurance records in certain situations related to healthcare provider qualifications and adverse actions. It also addresses the removal of identities in the disclosure process. SEC. 3. LIMITATION ON DISCLOSURE.

Amendment to section 5705(b) of title 38, United States Code restricts disclosure of information, records, or documents except for specific purposes outlined in the subsection.

SEC. 4. ACCESS TO RECORDS. Amendment to section 5705(b) of title 38, United States Code restricts disclosure of medical quality assurance records and documents subject to section 552a of title 5, except as authorized under this section. Access to these records is limited to protect the identities of participants in the quality assurance process. Medical quality assurance records under section 552a cannot be disclosed under section 552 of title 5. Section 5705 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to replace "specified in" with "accomplished in accordance with" in subsection (d)(2).
